channel.title: Help with skill capes!
channel.description:
I need help i am able to wear a skillcape withought being 99 look: [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/8x2zxs.png[/img]
can anyone help me with and go in teamviewer plz reply or send me a pm

item.title: Help with skill capes!
item.dc:creator: @Nick-World Nick-World
item.description:
@Nick-World wrote:

[quote=“Owner Dutch, post:13, topic:386796”]Nick-world u know how stupid u seem O.o he’s explaining u u only have to follow he’s instructions.
Gg Ashton[/quote]
your stupid u dumb fuck im trying to learn this is the help section u fuck

Read full topic

item.title: Help with skill capes!
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Dutch Owner Dutch
item.description:
@Owner_Dutch wrote:

Nick-world u know how stupid u seem O.o he’s explaining u u only have to follow he’s instructions.
Gg Ashton

Read full topic

item.title: Help with skill capes!
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“Nick-World, post:11, topic:386796”][quote author=Ashton51 link=topic=482566.msg3534081#msg3534081 date=1300415731]

Open up ItemAssistant.java and search for something like this:

And under that method youll probably see stuff listed there like this:

           [code=java]if (itemName.contains("infinity")) {
		c.magicLevelReq = 50;
		c.defenceLevelReq = 25;		
	}
	               if(itemName.contains("splitbark")) {
		c.magicLevelReq = 40;
		c.defenceLevelReq = 40;
	}[/code]

Bascially all you need to do is make a new if statement like this:

            [code=java]if(itemName.contains("Defence Skillcape")) {
                    c.defenceLevelReq = 99;
            }[/code]

Just do that until you have all skillcapes in and that should fix your problem. Though I might be mistaken.

it doesnt work i can still wear the capes

In that same method, find the switch statement that looks like this

Add a new case with the itemId and have it return the requirement, do this for each cape

Could you maybe do this in TEAMVIERWER?

No, But you can do it yourself since I explained it at an elementary level

But since you are still helpless, I’ll do one for you…

case ####://Replace the #### with the skillcape Item ID. c.strengthLevelReq = 99;//This is clearly for the strength skillcape. return;

itemAssistant.java:706: not a statement
14077 ARROW UNDER 1

1 error

You can’t just toss it out in the open, I told you to put it under the switch(itemId) in the getRequirements() method in your ItemAssistant class.

so the case is the item id case(id)

Yes it should look like this case (ItemId):
And you can’t just pop it anywhere, It has to be included in the correct switch statement.

I would advise brushing up a bit on your Java skills before attempting to create your own private server.
[/quote]
okay i got it was able to compile it with no errors and im still being able to wear it?[/quote]
Did you restart the server after you compiled?

Also if its still not working then you did something wrong…

Read full topic

Just do that until you have all skillcapes in and that should fix your problem. Though I might be mistaken.

it doesnt work i can still wear the capes

In that same method, find the switch statement that looks like this

Add a new case with the itemId and have it return the requirement, do this for each cape

Could you maybe do this in TEAMVIERWER?

But since you are still helpless, I’ll do one for you…

itemAssistant.java:706: not a statement
14077 ARROW UNDER 1

1 error

You can’t just toss it out in the open, I told you to put it under the switch(itemId) in the getRequirements() method in your ItemAssistant class.

so the case is the item id case(id)
[/quote]
Yes it should look like this case (ItemId):
And you can’t just pop it anywhere, It has to be included in the correct switch statement.

I would advise brushing up a bit on your Java skills before attempting to create your own private server.[/quote]
okay i got it was able to compile it with no errors and im still being able to wear it?

Read full topic
